regions.sizing_notes: US sizing uses numeric sizes for shoes and letter sizes (XS-XXXL) or numeric waist sizes for clothing. Men's and women's sizing are separate.
UK shoe sizes are typically 1 size smaller than US. Clothing uses UK-specific numeric sizes that differ from US.
EU uses metric-based sizing. Shoe sizes are typically 1-1.5 sizes larger than US. Clothing uses numeric sizes (32-52 for women, 42-56+ for men).
Japanese sizing runs smaller than US/EU. Shoe sizes use centimeter-based measurements. Clothing uses S/M/L/XL system but smaller than Western equivalents.
Chinese sizing is similar to Japanese but may vary by brand. Generally runs smaller than US/EU sizes. Uses metric measurements.
Direct foot length measurement in centimeters. Most accurate method for shoe sizing. Measure from heel to longest toe.
